content.description: Short route on grittier stuff than Hammer and Drill to the right. Slabby. Requires friction so chalk up. Sloped crimps. Only a move or two but fun to sequence.
content.location: Last route to the left. Marks the entrance up the hill of Poisen Death Scree.

content.description: Climb to the left side of the overhang on good shelves and jugs. Reach out and around for a decent right-hand crimp go for the lip and do a strenuous mantle. Then its a bit slopey and could do with some sweeping...
content.protection: Pad. Spotter. Exit moves are gritty. Don't fall in the manhole.
content.location: The boulder problem that tackles the roof on the blue-black boulder overhanging the pipeline.

content.description: Start to the right in the obvious drill scar from the pipeline construction blasters and crimp your way up. Once past the start weave your way to the chains. Crux is at the bottom.
content.protection: Place a small cam about 15 feet up in a pocket, then a couple larger pieces in the horizontal break which splits the face and the last piece on the right side of the pillar. Its a bit loose here but its easy ground. I think my rack was a .4, .75 or .5 and a 3 (BD sizes). Two Bolt Anchor with some long chains. Good for toprope. I wouldn't really want to fall on any of the gear.
content.location: The route starts right off the pipeline trail beside Telephone Pole #49.

content.description: Start holds strattle the deep drill scar then its up into beautiful finger locks within the furrow and hop to the horn on top. Fun moves on unique holds.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. Be conscious of the loose shale as you walk off.
content.location: The first problem on the big blue-black prow 50 feet past the telephone pole.
